summary: The "right of reply" is a legal principle enshrined in EU law that allows individuals or entities to respond to information or statements that may adversely affect their reputation or rights. This concept is particularly relevant in the context of media and public discourse, where misinformation can lead to reputational damage. The right of reply ensures that affected parties have the opportunity to present their side, thereby promoting fairness and transparency in information processing. It is a critical component of the broader regulatory framework aimed at protecting personal dignity and fostering responsible communication within the EU.
